value.title: How to Do Power BI Mapping With Latitude and Longitude Only
value.excerpt: You can just use latitude and longitude to visualize data on the map. In this video, you will learn how you can do that with the map visual in Power BI. Read more and download the dataset from my blog article link here: https://radacad.com/how-to-do-power-bi-mapping-with-latitude-and-longitude-only
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/m2Rov1x3mIE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Set Power BI Data Color   All Visuals to Follow Same Color for the Same Data Point
value.excerpt: You can set the color in every visual in Power BI easily. You can also set the color of multiple visuals at the same time using Themes. However, what if you want to set the same color for the same data point? For example, You want the Gender Female to be always colored Orange in all the charts and visuals.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-FG0DSSAr60" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: What is Power BI Dataflow and Why you should use it
value.excerpt: Dataflows are an important component in the Power BI architecture. Using them can enhance the development and maintenance of your Power BI solution significantly. However, there are many Power BI implementations that are not using this functionality, even though it is already more than three years passed

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Understanding context transition
value.excerpt: Context transition is one of the most obscure topics for DAX newbies. Learn how it works, its effects, and how to leverage it rather than be scared of it. Article and download: https://sql.bi/751407?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Understanding Group By Columns in Power BI
value.excerpt: How Power BI uses the Group By Columns attribute of a column and how you can leverage it in specific scenarios.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/790034?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Build Power BI visuals and reports
value.excerpt: visualize, data visualization

topItems.title: Scope report design requirements
topItems.excerpt: Gathering appropriate inputs to scope your report design requirements involves identifying your audience, determining the suitable report types, and defining their interface and experience requirements. This module provides you with a strong foundation on which to learn how to plan your report design requirements.

topItems.title: Work with Power BI visuals
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to choose from the exceptional visuals that Power BI makes available to you. Formatting visuals will direct the userâ€™s attention to exactly where you want it, while helping to make the visual easier to read and interpret. You will also learn about how to use key performance indicators (KPIs).

topItems.title: Create a data-driven story with Power BI reports
topItems.excerpt: Power BI helps you create vibrant, highly useful reports that form a cohesive, data-driven story. Youâ€™ll learn how to use buttons, bookmarks, and other navigation techniques. Additionally, youâ€™ll learn how to integrate Power BI reports with other applications. Power BI visuals can interact with each other, letting the user see exactly which data is appealing to them. Youâ€™ll also explore Power BI report themes to create a unified reporting experience across all reports.

value.title: Scope report design requirements
value.excerpt: Gathering appropriate inputs to scope your report design requirements involves identifying your audience, determining the suitable report types, and defining their interface and experience requirements. This module provides you with a strong foundation on which to learn how to plan your report design requirements.

value.title: Use Apache Spark in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Apache Spark is a core technology for large-scale data analytics. Microsoft Fabric provides support for Spark clusters, enabling you to analyze and process data at scale.

value.title: A technique to count anything in Power Query and some in DAX too
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you a technique to count any text in a cell in Power query and DAX. value.title: Avoid refresh errors when importing files in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you refreshed Power BI files and got errors due to missing columns or unwanted columns? Here I show you how to avoid new columns for getting added and refresh error from missing columns.  I learnt this by watching Microsoft Power BI webinar with Chris Webb: https://info.microsoft.com/CO-PowerBI-WBNR-FY16-06Jun-21-Amazing-Things-with-Power-BI-Registration.html?Is=Website

value.title: Can you refresh a single table in Power BI?
value.excerpt: Frustrated that a you can only do a full refresh? Patrick takes it to the next level by showing how you can refresh only a single table in your Power BI dataset. This is a great option for targeted refresh and avoid potential overhead.
